titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Their Papers, 1872-1983 and undated, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: Abel Ramirez

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Masterson Family Papers, 1872-1983 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The collection contains material documenting the interests of the Masterson Family in the JY Ranch and petroleum industries.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Masterson family were a pioneer Texas ranching family, owners of the JY Ranch, and breeders of Aberdeen Angus cattle. The ranch, begun by Robert B. Masterson in the 1880s, consisted of some 73,000 acres and was later operated by his descendents for three generations. In 1957, following the death of Masterson's grandson, Tom Masterson Jr., a well known cattleman and longtime director of the Texas and Southwestern Cattle Raisers Association, the ranch was sold to G. H. and Ed Lawrance of San Antonio, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains material documenting the interests of the Masterson Family in the ranching and petroleum industries. Included are correspondence, legal material, financial material, scrapbook material, and printed material. It bulks (1945-1957) with financial and legal materials dealing with ranch business and estate and trust management. Also, the collection contains a considerable amount of correspondence dealing with business and family matters.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Masterson Family Papers, 1872-1983 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

bibliography.head: Additional Sources
bibliography.bibref: Scott, Z. T. Robert Benjamin Masterson: Pioneer Ranchman of the Texas Panhandle; a Character Sketch. Austin, Texas: s.n., 1930.
The Handbook of Texas has published a more in-depth on-line biography of Robert Benjamin Masterson at http://www.tsha.utexas.edu/handbook/online/search.html

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:

list.item: Beaumont Stinnett oral history interview [sound recording], 1956
